other_tests.procedure_name: Cardiac stress test with radionuclide imaging
other_tests.findings: Left ventricular ejection fraction of 33% and a reversible anterolateral defect.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Worsened to 22% on echocardiography 7 months before current admission.

other_tests.findings: Left ventricular ejection fraction of 22%, mild mitral and tricuspid regurgitation.
Left ventricular ejection fraction of 23%, dilatation of left atrium and left ventricle, diffuse hypokinesis.
Sinus rhythm at a rate of 66 beats per minute, new ST-segment elevations in ECG leads II, III, aVF, V3, and V4.
other_tests.changes_over_time: New ST-segment elevations compared to an earlier tracing.

other_tests.findings: Trace pericardial effusion and decreased ventricular contractile function.
All lead measurements were within normal limits.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent interrogation showed abnormal measurements, indicating lead migration.

other_tests.findings: Voltage of cardiac electrogram significantly decreased, failure to capture with pacing.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Voltage fell from 11.2 mV to 1.5 mV, lead impedance decreased from 640 ohms to 240 ohms.

other_tests.findings: A high-density left pleural effusion and ICD lead perforating the pericardium.
